block.p: Jennifer Lynn Shook, a daughter of Linda and Merrick Shook of Mechanicsburg, Pa., was married there yesterday to Kenneth Craig Matthews, a son of Carol and Craig G. Matthews of Chatham, N.J. The Rev. Chester P. Snyder performed the ceremony at St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church.
Mr. and Mrs. Matthews, both 26, graduated from Villanova University, where they met.

Jennifer Lynn Shook, a daughter of Linda and Merrick Shook of Mechanicsburg, Pa., was married there yesterday to Kenneth Craig Matthews, a son of Carol and Craig G. Matthews of Chatham, N.J. The Rev. Chester P. Snyder performed the ceremony at St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church.
Mr. and Mrs. Matthews, both 26, graduated from Villanova University, where they met.

The bride, a certified public accountant, is a senior financial analyst with Highmark Blue Cross Blue Shield in Camp Hill, Pa. Her mother is a computer systems programmer in Mechanicsburg with the Defense Department. Her father, who retired as a national distribution operations manager in Mechanicsburg for I.B.M., now is the manager of United States transportation operations for Tyco Electronics, a manufacturer of electronic components in Harrisburg, Pa.

The bridegroom is a field engineer in Philadelphia for the Turner Construction Corporation. His father is president and chief operating officer of the KeySpan Corporation, the utility holding company in Brooklyn. He is also the president of the Brooklyn Philharmonic Orchestra and chairman of the advisory board of the Salvation Army of Greater New York.
